# CXCallController

**Class**

A programmatic interface for interacting with and observing calls.

## Declaration

```swift
class CXCallController
```

## Overview

A [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController] object interacts with calls by performing actions, which are represented by instances of [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallAction] subclasses. You can request that one or more actions be performed in a single [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXTransaction] object using the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController/request(_:completion:)] method. A transaction may be rejected by the system for one of the reasons listed in the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXErrorCodeRequestTransactionError-swift.struct/Code] enumeration.

Each [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController] object manages a [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserver] object, which can be accessed using the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallController/callObserver] property. You can provide an object conforming to the [doc://com.apple.callkit/documentation/CallKit/CXCallObserverDelegate] protocol to the call observer in order to be notified of any changes to active calls.

## Creating New Call Controllers

- **init()**: Initializes a new call controller with a private, serial queue, which is used for calling completion blocks.
- **init(queue:)**: Initializes a new call controller with a specified queue, which is used for calling completion blocks.

## Accessing the Call Observer

- **callObserver**: Returns an observer for active calls.

## Requesting Transactions

- **request(_:completion:)**: Requests that the actions in the specified transaction be asynchronously performed by the telephony provider.
- **requestTransaction(with:completion:)**: Requests that the transaction that contains the specified action be asynchronously performed by the telephony provider.
- **requestTransaction(with:completion:)**: Requests that the transaction that contains the specified actions be asynchronously performed by the telephony provider.

## Errors

- **CXErrorCodeRequestTransactionError**
- **CXErrorCodeRequestTransactionError.Code**: Error codes for the CallKit error domain.
- **CXErrorDomainRequestTransaction**: Domain for errors when requesting a transaction from a call controller.

## Outgoing calls

- **Sending End-to-End Encrypted VoIP Calls**: Initiate VoIP calls when your server can’t determine whether an outgoing notification is a request for a VoIP call due to metadata encryption.
- **CXTransaction**: An object that contains zero or more action objects for a call controller to perform.
- **CXStartCallAction**: An encapsulation of the act of initiating an outgoing call.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
